titleStmt.title: Robert McKee to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4844

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Mt Vernon Ky
April 6th 1864
His Excellency
Governor Thos E Bramlet

Dear Sir I was indited in the Rockcastle Circuit Court for Gameing and when the case was called I plead guilty and Judgment went against me for $20, I am not a gambler but some times have played for mear amusement and in this case I with two other boys was playing a game at 5 cts nearly to make it interesting to pass off time The Execution is now in the hands of the Sheriff against me.
I ask your Excellency to interpose in my behalf and remit the fines, and believe me your obt sevt,

Governor I was the witness before the grand Jury in the case of the Comwlth vs Mr McKee having been in the telegraph Room one night I Saw him & two other yong men playing a 5 cts game and so told the grand Jury. McKee went into Court plead guilty and Judgment was entered against him he is a Clever gentleman and true Union man. And I hope your Excellency will remit the fine for him

I am your obt Sevt
Charles Kirtley
Governor we hope your Excellency will interpose in behalf of Mr McKee and remit the fine as we are satisfied he merits it he being a clever gentlemen and true to his Contry

Yours most truly
M. J. Miller
F B McClary
M A Brooks
G. O. R. McCall
J. A. Crawford
1st Lt 14th Ky Cavl
Cops 2d Batt
Edwin Shivel D. C.
Rockcastle Circuit Court
J. J. Williams
M C Miller
Wm Stigall
Alfred Smith

Rockcastle Cir Ct
vs
Robt McKee

Remit except fees & costs & put note into is Charles Kirtley stating that there has not been any order extending the time - but the old order did not limit the time within any period. A only withold bounties after 1st Apl
